concept.title: Font-face
concept.shortdesc: Font-face is one of the most effective methods for making sure your font renders itself just how you want it.

conbody.p: @font-face- this CSS rule allows for the replacement of fonts with other fonts from different formats if the fonts which are being used are not found within the parameters of the browser being used. This means that if a given font is not found, the site will be rendered with the next available font on the list (or re-set to the default of the given generic family, if none are found). Each of these subsequent fonts can be retrieved from a different Open-source format, as long as the format itself is specified in the rule.
